summary: This bill, the Promoting Permanency Through Kinship Families Act, aims to remove barriers to kinship care, foster, and adoptive placements for children. It amends parts B and E of title IV of the Social Security Act to encourage kinship guardianship, provides resources and services to kin caregivers, and promotes permanency options. Key provisions include changes to state plan requirements, foster care assistance, case review processes, and criminal record checks. It also addresses age limits for caregivers, participation in kinship guardianship assistance, and AFDC eligibility for foster care maintenance payments.
